page.title: 13Parish Hall (part one)
page.content: The Parish Hall was erected in 1922 and consists of two World War I ex- army huts joined together. Additions and improvements have since been made. It is at present administered by Trustees, but this system is now in a process of change. The Hall is used as a meeting place for village organisations, the activities of which are many and varied. The Playgroup, which caters for pre_school children, meets for three mornings per week during the School term. The Mother and Toddler Group, which is pre_Play_ group, meets on one afternoon a week. The Over 60s Club meets monthly except during the summer. The Women's Institute uses the Hall on the first Wednesday of every month, and also on other occasions. This organisation has been using the Hall continuously since its erection in 1922.
